name: Next.js
description: A React framework for building static and dynamic web applications with server-side rendering and static site generation.

name: Sequelize
description: An ORM for Node.js, which supports multiple database dialects like PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and MSSQL.

name: Node.js
description: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine for building scalable network applications.

name: MongoDB
description: A NoSQL database used for handling large volumes of unstructured data, often used with Node.js applications.

name: PostgreSQL
description: An open-source relational database management system, known for its support of complex queries and data integrity.

name: Android Development
description: The process of creating mobile applications for Android devices using Java, Kotlin, and other Android SDK tools.

name: React
description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly single-page applications, with reusable components.

name: Vue.js
description: A progressive JavaScript framework used for building user interfaces and single-page applications.

name: Angular
description: A platform for building mobile and desktop web applications using TypeScript and JavaScript.

name: JavaScript
description: A versatile programming language used for both client-side and server-side development.

name: TypeScript
description: A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing, making it ideal for building large-scale applications.

name: HTML5
description: The latest version of the HTML standard for structuring web content, supporting modern web features like audio, video, and geolocation.

name: CSS3
description: The latest version of CSS, used for styling web pages, including layout techniques like Flexbox and Grid.

name: Bootstrap
description: A front-end framework for building responsive, mobile-first websites, with pre-designed components and styles.

name: Tailwind CSS
description: A utility-first CSS framework for creating custom designs without leaving the HTML.

name: Android Studio
description: The official IDE for Android development, which provides tools for building, testing, and debugging Android applications.

name: Git
description: A distributed version control system for managing source code in software development projects.

name: Jenkins
description: An open-source automation server commonly used for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD).

name: Docker
description: An open-source platform for automating the deployment of applications in lightweight containers.

name: Kubernetes
description: An open-source platform for automating the deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

name: Figma
description: A cloud-based design tool for collaborative user interface and experience design.

name: Adobe Photoshop
description: A graphic design software used for editing raster graphics, photo retouching, and creating design mockups.

name: Adobe Illustrator
description: A vector graphics software used for creating scalable illustrations, logos, and icons.

name: Sketch
description: A vector-based design tool for designing user interfaces and web applications.

name: InVision
description: A web-based platform used for designing interactive prototypes and collaborating on design projects.

name: UX/UI Design
description: The process of designing user experiences and interfaces that are intuitive, engaging, and easy to navigate.

name: SASS
description: A CSS preprocessor that allows you to write more maintainable and reusable CSS with variables, mixins, and nested rules.

name: Webpack
description: A module bundler for JavaScript applications that bundles multiple files into one or more bundles, optimizing performance.

name: Redux
description: A predictable state container for JavaScript apps, often used with React to manage global application state.

name: Socket.IO
description: A JavaScript library for real-time web applications, enabling bidirectional event-based communication between web clients and servers.

name: MongoDB Atlas
description: A cloud-based NoSQL database service built on MongoDB, providing database management and scalability features.

name: Swift
description: A general-purpose, compiled programming language used for building iOS and macOS applications.

name: Kotlin
description: A statically-typed programming language that runs on the JVM and is used for Android development, offering more concise and expressive syntax than Java.

name: Firebase
description: A platform developed by Google for building mobile and web applications, with features like authentication, database, and cloud storage.

name: Vagrant
description: A tool for building and maintaining virtualized development environments, improving reproducibility and portability of development setups.

name: Elasticsearch
description: A distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine, designed for horizontal scalability and real-time search operations.

name: Contentful
description: A headless CMS that helps manage and deliver content to any platform, including websites, mobile apps, and more.

name: Vercel
description: A cloud platform for static sites and serverless functions, optimized for front-end frameworks like React and Next.js.

name: AWS Lambda
description: A serverless compute service that runs code in response to events and automatically manages the compute resources required.

name: Salesforce
description: A cloud-based customer relationship management (CRM) platform with tools for marketing, sales, and service automation.

name: GraphQL
description: A query language for your API, allowing clients to request only the data they need.

name: API Testing
description: The process of testing API endpoints to ensure they function correctly and handle edge cases and errors properly.
